intro: Tribonanthes minor, commonly known as the small tribonanthe, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Its flowers are often pale yellow or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Tribonanthes minor is often found in rocky soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
